WRITING.TITLE: DD tip
WRITING.TEXT: That dog Fulton's with 100% effectiveness under any condition (provided he can reach intended Fultonee). Sandstorms, no problem. Roof cover? No problem. Cool exploit I found. Thought I'd share.
Mark the tanks, hide, bombard, repeat... All the while spamming Quiets fire command. Not so tough.

WRITING.TITLE: Walmart, midnight, question.
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

I can identify most with Johnny Sasaki. My military career was a six year case of diarrhea. No joke. Korean food, man. Tasty, but you'll suffer for the pleasure you take in eating it. I did, at least...

Guess I simply read it. Should have "read" it before I got all hypey. No matter, compared to the amount of words spent on other non-issues, he still spent too little time focusing on the games most unforgivable flaw. I stand on my previous level of disapproval. This guy is a hack.

Some fair points, definitely. Some colossal diatribes against pressing start buttons and terrible hair, too.
I read the whole thing, waiting to see how he would dog Snakes molester mustache. Never happened. Not a mention.
Screw this guy. He was paying attention to jack shit. He spent more time whimpering about textures and audio compression than he did on the weaker points of the story and gameplay. Admits that he played it like Gears of War, but can't understand why he didn't enjoy the experience. He spent a lot of time prefacing his rant with a nice rant-spoiler warmup too.
Real wordy. Reads like he spent more time editing his article than playing the game he is pissing on.
...and not once did he bring up the tragedy growing out of Snakes upper lip. Boo!
Prolly gonna get an answer somewhere around September 1.
Louie Anderson, dubbed by Fran Drescher.
"Flying Ant" had a name.
That bastard just has to come to the US. Everywhere but, so far.

Not sure about the cartoons, but Dr. Morbius was a regular ol' scientist with some sort of blood disease who tries to cure himself with a bat of some sort and as one might guess, became a vampire. I recall seeing him run around with The Midnight Sons in the mid nineties, and hadn't given the character any thought until I saw this thread.
Morbius.

...kinda. Playing through at the moment, actually. Not as bad as I remember, but still my least favorite in the series. Kinda cool watching Snake kick ass in the third person, and Raiden isn't as horrible as I remember, but I can still gripe about Fat Man, Ray, Big Shell itself, Solidus and a few other things that I don't think are up to snuff. Fortune is awesome though. One of my favorite MGS characters.
Also, WTF is with you pussies downvoting someone's conflicting opinion? Every time I talk about MGS2 here I get downvoted to oblivion. I get the impression that my words peirce your dry anuses with the ease of a 90mph cucumber. Sheesh!

Nah, you are experiencing the same shock I had as a day one player. Nothing about the Tanker chapter was too out of the ordinary, but when it switched to the Plant I was sitting around scratching my head just like you are now. Everyone was. This led to derision. I still kinda hate that game to this day because of it...

Yeah, it looks like it will probably be Guardians who link the Galactic threat to our Earth bound heroes.
That loose thread about Quills dad... a being of pure light; perhaps Momma Quill was blinded by the intense reflections of a horned out Norrin Radd...

Tru. Dat.
Fingers crossed that Surfer might soon find himself at home in the universe he belongs in.

WRITING.TITLE: As overcrowded as Infinity War might seem, I am sad to see no mention (possibilty?) of this guy being involved in the conflict

WRITING.TEXT: Tru dat. I'll need a capture card. Got a spare?
Quick, someone get me some Adderal!

I can vouch that it IS possible to S rank these missions solo. I've done all of em. Every single one. With no multiplayer assistance. Upgrading your missiles, carrying as much Fulton gear as possible, and utilizing the environment to remain out of sight is key. Also, after about 30 or so attempts at any of these, patterns emerge, once you can see and know what's gonna happen next, exploitation makes vehicle battles a snap.

Damn, I don't know if I have what it takes. This lil' 300+ hours I've got on peace walker has taken from the date of the HD release until last night. Can't image how much time it will take me to log a thousan d Phantom Pain hours.
Oh, I know. I. Knooooooooow...
You may have become "finished", but I'm sure you didn't complete this bastard in in 11 hours. No way.
Solo. No guides, FAQs, or advice from fellow players.
Nah. Can't put the final Gear Rex down with non-lethal for the life of me.
This song is a deep echo of Kaz and Ocelots feelings toward Big Boss.

I don't care who directs a movie as long as its someone who directs Wayans Brothers films. And if the movie is to be perfect, it must star both Gilbert Gottfried and Melissa McCarthy.
So, I'm not too hard to please...
Director: Malcom D. Lee (Scary Movie 5)
Solid Snake/Big Boss: Melissa McCarthy
Otacon/Huey: Gilbert Gottfried
To round out the cast, I suggest exclusive casting of the previously mentioned legends in all roles, augmented by practical makeup effects and mo-cap if necessary.
Also, if we could get the talented individual who pens the screenplays for Michael Bay's impeccably written and superbly edited Transformers films, MGS would surely become the franchise to topple Marvel at the box offfce.
Melissa McCarthy.
